body.name: Walfront USB Camera Module, HBV-W202012HD Camera Module HD USB Interface for WinXP/Win7/Win8/Win 10/OS X/L inux/Android, 1280x720P
body.stockDetail: Only 13 left in stock - order soon.

Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 13 hrs 42 mins
features: 【SUPPORT MODEL】: 1MP high‑definition lens, image picture is clearer, 50° field of view, wider field of view. Strong compatibility, adapt to a variety of systems, suitable for WinXP/Win7/Win8/Win10/OSX/Linux/Android.
【WIDELY APPLICATION】: Wide application, Wide range of applications, this product can be applied to various industry products. QR scanning, face recognition.
【LARGE VISUAL RANGE】: With 136 degree field of view, the visual range is larger, have a wider view. Support manual focusing, you can adjust according to the distance of the object.
【GOOD FEATURE】: Using high‑definition photosensitive chip OV9726, stable performance and clearer images. Support for OTG, standard UVC protocol, drive USB interface, plug and play.
【Support Access IR Supplementary Light】: Support access to IR supplementary light, can be connected to IR supplementary light, night vision picture is clearer.
body.description: Specification:Item Type: Camera Module Product Model: HBV-W202012HDPixel: 1MPPhotosensitive Chip: OV9726 (1/6in)Field of View/focal Length: 50°/3.2mmFormat: MJPG/YUY2Resolution: 1280x720Focus Mode: Manual Focus (twist lens)Function Introduction: QR scanning, face recognitionOutput: USB 2.0Support System: For WinXP/Win7/Win8/Win 10/OS X/L inux/AndroidWire: Standard approx. 50cm / 19.7inWorking Temperature: -30℃~70℃Size: Approx. 30 x 25 x 14mm / 1.2 x 1 x 0.6inFill Light: External LED infrared fill light can be connectedPackage List:1 x Camera Module

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 15 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with the FLSUN V400
reviews.reviewText: It works with the FLSUN V400, just plug it into the Speeder Unit and watch it from the Dashboard Webcam window. I struggled a bit finding a casing and mount, but there are some free Arduino cam files that are a very close fit with minor tweaking, and a few mounts you can download stl files for if you have a working 3D printer handy. The image isn't as good as Creality's AI Camera, but that camera doesn't come with USB output and it's around double the cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For the price point there's nothing to complain about. I use it for a 3d printer and I have put it on 1280x840p and the picture quality is good. Can be tricky to get it in focus it is very sensitive a little move is a lot of focus change, I thought it was broken but just took a little bit to find the right focus. I wish the field of view was better however I am filming like less than 8 inches away so its kinda ridiculous to say it's bad field of view it's fine

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well on my Andriod phone with USB on the go
reviews.reviewText: I'm using this as a rear view camera on my electric bike. I get a more stable view than the handle bar mounted mirrors which is a life saver when going into town on the narrow county farm roads.

reviews.reviewTitle: Un defecto en el plástico del visor.
reviews.reviewText: El producto llegó a tiempo y es adecuado en calidad-precio. Tuvo un defecto en el plástico, como se puede apreciar en las fotos; está ladeado, creí que el cilindro que conecta con el sensor estaba mal puesto, pero no.El lente debe ajustarse para que resulte una imagen suficiente, que no es muy nítida y tiene aberración óptica hacia las esquinas y los laterales. El tercio central de la imagen es el que se ve "pasable".A pesar de lo anterior, funciona adecuadamente y volvería a comprarlo para algún proyecto DIY. El cable USB mide 48.5cm. Es Plug&Play, lo conecté en dos sistemas operativos, uno Windows y otro Linux y ambos reconocieron el periférico sin problema. La resolución es 1280x720p.Haré una prueba de conectarlo vía OTG a un smartphone con Android, a ver que tal.
